body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
```
Release Version:   3.1.0-beta.1
Git Commit Hash:   b8b9327f615e9c54a08772b53505a9f864ce55cb
Git Commit Branch: release-3.1
UTC Build Time:    2020-01-12 05:58:49
Rust Version:      rustc 1.37.0-nightly (0e4a56b4b 2019-06-13)
```

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->
Darwin seastar.local 19.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 19.2.0: Sat Nov  9 03:47:04 PST 2019; root:xnu-6153.61.1~20/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
```
printf %s\\n > tikv.toml '[rocksdb]' 'max_open_files = 20000'
tikv-server -C ./tikv.toml --pd=127.0.0.1 --config-check
tikv-server -C ./tikv.toml --pd=127.0.0.1  2>&1 | grep -o 'max.open.files..........'
```

### What did you expect?

Using `max_open_files` should either work correctly or should cause configuration validation to fail. Silently accepting invalid configuration items can lead to serious security issues and a lot of wasted time for DBAs.

### What did happened?

TiKV silently accepted `max_open_files` instead of `max-open-files`, even though `max_open_files` is invalid and has no effect.
title: Configuration validation doesn't find misspelled option names in config file
